title: IMD Weather updates: 'Cold day' warning for Delhi-NCR for 2 days, dense fog to engulf north India - India Today
text: Dense fog is expected to engulf most parts of Northern India including Punjab, Haryana, south-east Uttarakhand, Uttar Pradesh, western Bihar and north-west Rajasthan for the next two days, the India Meteorological Department (IMD) said on Friday.The weather body also issued a "cold-day" alert for the Delhi-NCR region.In its advisory, the weather department added that the foggy conditions may affect flight operations, vehicular movement and train operations in the region.Earlier on Friday evening, moderate fog was observed in parts of Uttar Pradesh and isolated pockets of north-west Rajasthan, Punjab, south-east Uttarakhand, Assam, Haryana and Delhi. Fog layer (encircled grey patch) over Punjab, Haryana, Delhi, Uttar Pradesh, west Bihar and northwest Rajasthan. (Photo:X) COLD DAY IN DELHIThe IMD also issued a "cold-day" alert and said "dense to very dense fog" is likely to be witnessed in Delhi-NCR for the next two days.Notably, a cold day takes place when, on two consecutive days, the minimum temperature of a place is lower than 10 degrees Celsius and the maximum temperature (or day temperature) drops by 4.5 to 6.4 degrees below normal.The maximum temperature of the national capital settled at 19.8 degrees Celsius on Friday, a notch below the season's average. The 24-hour average Air Quality Index (AQI) was recorded at 382, in the "very poor" category, at 4 pm as per the IMD.An AQI between zero and 50 is considered "good", 51 and 100 "satisfactory", 101 and 200 "moderate", 201 and 300 "poor", 301 and 400 "very poor", and 401 and 500 "severe".Published By: Sudeep LavaniaPublished On: Dec 29, 2023ALSO READ | Several trains, flights delayed as dense fog engulfs North India; no relief till Jan 2
